alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Greenbrier County through 515 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Frankford, or near Renick, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Renick... Neola... Falling Spring... Beartown State Park... Rorer... Lewisburg Airport... and Alvon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
